examples.text: nearly half of all male crabs in natural populations possess a regenerated claw

definitions: (of an area or institution) having new and more vigorous life, especially in economic terms; revived

examples.text: the district is a regenerated area of the city

definitions: (of a person) reformed or reborn, especially in a spiritual or moral sense

examples.text: by Biblical standards you either are or you aren't a regenerated believer

definitions: (of a natural polymer, especially cellulose or a protein) precipitated as fibers following chemical processing

examples.text: the stability of regenerated cellulose is lower than that of native cellulose

shortDefinitions: precipitated as fibres following chemical processing
